intro: Crotalaria ramosissima var. kanuvayensis, commonly known as the Kanuvayensis Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is known for its distinctive yellow flowers and branched stems, which contribute to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and potentially useful in agricultural settings.
